channel.title: Asynchronous Requests :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Now that we’re more comfortable with using statements, let’s return to our request-making code: WebRequest request = WebRequest.Create("http://api.jokes.one/jod"); using Stream responseStream = response.GetStream() { StreamReader reader = new StreamReader(responseStream); string responseText= reader.ReadToEnd(); Console.WriteLine(responseText); } response.Close();The response.GetStream() triggers the http request, which hits the API and returns its result. Remember a HTTP request is streamed across the internet, then processed by the server, and the response streamed back. That can take some time (at least to a computer).
